definition: pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
Song of the Pipa Player, long poem by Tang poet Bai Juyi 白居易[Bai2 Ju1 yi4]

sentences.english: Shoun was fond of music and was a master of the harp, which his mother also played.
sentences.chinese: 正安雅好音樂，是琵琶高手，他的母親也頗通此道。

sentences.english: I'm just here looking for angryanglers.
sentences.chinese: 我來這裏是找“激怒琵琶魚”的。

sentences.english: He accompanied her singing on a lute-like instrument.
sentences.chinese: 他彈一件類似琵琶的樂器爲她伴奏。

sentences.english: And so is the nebulousness of Chinese property laws.
sentences.chinese: 另一個原因是猶抱琵琶半遮面的中國物權法。
《琵琶行》是白居易極負盛名的詩歌。

sentences.english: Lute was the general name for all Stradivarius in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 琵琶，在古代是所有彈絃樂器的總稱。

sentences.english: Some even live in the deepest depths of the ocean, such as anglerfish.
sentences.chinese: 有些魚甚至生活在海洋最深處，如琵琶魚。

sentences.english: This is my opinion about the application of Hand Strum the Lute.
sentences.chinese: 這是本人對這手揮琵琶演示的意見。

sentences.english: The pipa is the most popular of China's many plucked stringed instruments.
sentences.chinese: 琵琶是中國許多彈撥絃樂器中最受人歡迎的一種。

sentences.english: This paper laid out the changes and status of the environment of Lake Biwa.
sentences.chinese: 報道了日本琵琶湖水環境的變化及現狀。

sentences.english: An angler fish appears to 'walk' across the ocean floor as it waits for its prey
sentences.chinese: 這條琵琶魚在等待獵物時彷彿是在海底“走路”一般。

sentences.english: There at the fording in the little boat the unknown man plays upon his lute.
sentences.chinese: 淺灘的小舟上有個不相識的人正彈著琵琶。

sentences.english: PEIPAH is now predominantly steered by the subtropical ridge ENE of it , inducing a weak NW movement.
sentences.chinese: 琵琶正沿副熱帶高壓脊的西南部向西北方向移動。

sentences.english: Part 4 is devoted to his music works and music features.
sentences.chinese: 程午加的琵琶作品及其音樂特色。

sentences.english: Then the angler closes her mouth .

definition: zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
